name: Basic section
description:
The Basic section is a two-column (50/50) layout pattern for presenting a single topic with a mix of content blocks. It can include text, images, videos, lists, code snippets, logos, and call-to-action elements. 

Choose this pattern to communicate a single topic that can be clearly conveyed in a side-by-side, two-column structure.
usage:
Use the Basic section to communicate one idea and support that idea in a variety of content blocks. To promote readability and cohesion, limit each section to seven or fewer content blocks. This section works best when the copy is concise and each block supports the main topic. Avoid mixing unrelated messages or different content types.

The Basic section typically works best with a title on the left and supporting material on the right. For medium size, the macro has 50/50 and full-width variants to accommodate different content needs.

### Supported UI blocks for the [Content area](/basic-section#anatomy)

1.  **Subtitle / subheading** \- Add more hierarchy beneath the title, using H4 or H5.
2.  **Description / body text** \- Use for long-form descriptions or explanations, when full sentences and paragraphs work best.
3.  **Image** - Include a 3:2 or 16:9 ratio image to illustrate or enhance the content including: photography, isometric illustrations, diagrams, and similar visuals. The image can include an optional caption.
4.  **Video** \- Embed and link video content in 16:9 ratio.
5.  **[List](/list)** - List up to 10 items, with bullet type options including: none, bullet, status, or number.
6.  **Code block** - Display pre-formatted code.
7.  **[Logo block](/logo-block)** - Display related logos such as customers or partners.
8.  **[Linked logo block](/linked-logo-block)** \- Display logos that link to additional resources.
9.  **[CTA block](/cta-block)** - Share one or more call-to-action elements, including a primary button, secondary button, and link.
10.  **[Notification](/notification)** - Highlight alerts, updates, or contextual messages within the section.

### When to use

*   You’re not sure what other section to use, this is the fallback
*   To present one clear topic with supporting explanatory content
*   For both marketing and informational content that requires a flexible pattern
*   The 50/50 layout balances text and media for better readability.

### When not to use

*   When multiple topics or groups require clearer separation, or the content needs to be quickly scanned like a list. Consider the [Tiered list](/tiered-list), [Equal heights](/equal-heights), or [Divided section](/divided-section) instead.
*   If one content block is sufficient, use the section for that particular purpose. For example, the [Logo section](/logo-section), [Linked logo section](/linked-logo-section), or [Resources](/resources).
*   When an immersive or highlight-oriented layout is appropriate, use the [Rich vertical list](/rich-vertical-list), or [Text spotlight](/text-spotlight) or [Data spotlight](/data-spotlight) sections.

table.name: Rule
table.description: The rule component indicates the beginning of a new section.

table.name: Heading
table.description: The section heading communicates the primary subject or theme of the section.

table.name: Eyebrow
table.description: The optional muted eyebrow placed above the section title. It provides additional contextual information or categorization for the section when needed.

table.name: Content area
table.description: The content area on the right side of the 50/50 layout where various block types can be placed. Supported blocks include text, images, lists, videos, code snippets, logos, CTAs, and other compatible patterns. The Basic Section layout provides flexible composition while maintaining structural consistency.

properties.name: Section rule
properties.description: The rule component indicates the beginning of a new pattern
properties.constraint: Only use the default style for the section-level rule

properties.name: Medium layout
properties.description: Indicate layout for medium size

properties.name: Heading
properties.description: 4-column width heading using H2

properties.name: Linked heading
properties.description: The heading can be used as a link when paired with a chevron(›) and a clear indication.

properties.name: Body
properties.description: 4-column width body text

properties.name: Block bottom padding
properties.description: The type of padding applied to the block
properties.constraint: The last block of the pattern must not have bottom padding.

properties.name: Bottom padding
properties.description: The type of padding applied to the bottom of the pattern

properties.name: Eyebrow
properties.description: The eyebrow placed above the heading using muted heading

properties.name: Subheading
properties.description: The subheading provides additional hierarchy beneath the main title
properties.constraint:
h4: up to 100 characters
h5: up to 160 characters

properties.name: Link CTA
properties.description: The text link used for contextual actions or pathways to more information. It uses a chevron (›) to indicate navigation to additional content or pages.

properties.name: Primary CTA
properties.description: The CTA used with the positive button style. It indicates a high-priority, positive action and is reserved for hero areas or other key call-to-action sections.

properties.name: Secondary CTA
properties.description: The CTA using the default button style. It is used for most actions that are positive but not primary, and may serve as the main CTA in non-hero sections.

properties.name: Text
properties.description: The code that is being shown inside of the code component.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: What semantic type the notification is.

properties.name: Border
properties.description: Wether the notification has a border or not. Borderless notifications are used for example in [Table](wiki-ref://grid-ymtdOF6n4R/i-aUPUyjNgjD).

properties.name: Inline
properties.description: Wether the title and description of the notification are being shown in one line. reduces the overall height of the notification allowing it to be used where space is at a premium.

properties.name: Title
properties.description: Sets the content of the title.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Sets the content of the description.

properties.name: Dismissible
properties.description: Wether or not the notification can be dismissed. If it can be dismissed the dismiss button is being shown.

properties.name: Actions
properties.description: Allows to give associated actions with the notification.

properties.name: Time stamp
properties.description: Can be set to the timestamp when the event when that triggered the notification took place.

properties.name: Logo block
properties.description: The logo block showcases a group of related images, such as a group of customer or partner logos.

Up to 10 logos
